recipes.name: Kid-Friendly Mini Calzones
ingredients: 3 French rolls or 1 loaf French bread
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: In a skillet, brown the ground beef and onion over medium heat. Drain off any excess grease.
Step 3: Add the pizza sauce, olives (if using), basil, and oregano to the beef mixture. Stir until well combined.
Step 4: Cut a thin slice off the top of each French roll or the top of the French bread loaf. Carefully hollow out the bottom of the rolls or loaf, leaving about 1/2 inch of bread around the edges.
Step 5: Sprinkle 3 tablespoons of mozzarella cheese into the bottom of each roll or half of the cheese into the hollowed-out loaf.
Step 6: Spoon the meat mixture into the rolls or loaf, on top of the cheese.
Step 7: Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella cheese over the meat mixture.
Step 8: Replace the tops of the rolls or bread loaf.
Step 9: Wrap each calzone individually in aluminum foil.
Step 10: Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or up to 24 hours, or freeze for later use.
Step 11: To bake refrigerated calzones: Place the foil-wrapped calzones on a baking sheet and bake for 40 minutes.
Step 12: To bake frozen calzones: Place the foil-wrapped calzones on a baking sheet and bake for 60-75 minutes, or until heated through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture three kid-friendly mini calzones, sliced to reveal the cheesy, beefy filling, on a rustic wooden board. Use warm, natural lighting from the side to highlight the golden crust and melted mozzarella.  A shallow depth of field focuses on the foreground calzone, blurring the background which includes a small bowl of pizza sauce for dipping and a scattering of fresh basil leaves.  The image should evoke a comforting, homey, and appetizing mood.  Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the texture of the bread and the colorful filling.

video_script.title: Kid-Friendly Mini Calzones
video_script.description: Learn how to make these easy and fun mini calzones, perfect for kids and the whole family!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of several golden-brown, delicious mini calzones, some cut open to reveal the cheesy, meaty filling.  A few rolls are unwrapped from foil, while others are still wrapped. In the background, you can see a cutting board and a knife. Focus on the appetizing look and texture of the calzones.
scenes.voice_over: These mini calzones are a fun, easy meal that the whole family will love!  Let's get started.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table. Group related ingredients: ground beef next to onion; pizza sauce next to olives, basil and oregano; French rolls next to mozzarella cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: ground beef, onion, pizza sauce, optional olives, basil, oregano, French rolls or a loaf of French bread, and mozzarella cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a skillet with ground beef and chopped onions browning, steam rising from the pan.
scenes.voice_over: In a skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef and onion.  Make sure to drain off any excess grease.

scenes.image_prompt: The same skillet as before, now with pizza sauce, olives, basil, and oregano being stirred into the browned beef and onion mixture. Focus on the mixture and the process of combining ingredients.
scenes.voice_over: Add in the pizza sauce, olives if you're using them, basil, and oregano. Stir everything together until it's well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a hand carefully hollowing out a French roll with a small spoon, leaving about a half-inch of bread around the edges. Another roll, already hollowed out, sits beside it. Show the hollowing tool clearly.
scenes.voice_over: Cut the top off each French roll and carefully hollow them out, leaving about a half-inch of bread around the edges. You can also use a loaf of French bread instead of rolls.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up, slightly overhead view of the hollowed-out rolls being filled first with a layer of mozzarella, then a spoonful of the meat sauce mixture, and finally, topped with more cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Sprinkle some mozzarella cheese in the bottom of each roll, then add a generous spoonful of the meat mixture. Top with more mozzarella.

scenes.image_prompt: A hand wrapping a filled calzone in aluminum foil, ensuring it’s completely covered.
scenes.voice_over: Put the tops back on the rolls. Wrap each calzone individually in aluminum foil.  Refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or up to 24. You can even freeze them for later!

scenes.image_prompt: Foil-wrapped calzones arranged on a baking sheet, ready to go into the oven.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Bake refrigerated calzones for 40 minutes, or frozen calzones for 60-75 minutes, until heated through and bubbly.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a finished, baked calzone on a plate, cut in half to show the melted cheese and savory filling. A side of marinara sauce for dipping is next to it.
scenes.voice_over: These mini calzones are delicious served with a side of marinara sauce for dipping. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a crispier crust, bake the calzones unwrapped for the last 10 minutes of cooking.
You can customize the filling by adding other ingredients such as mushrooms, peppers, or pepperoni.
If freezing the calzones, allow them to cool completely before wrapping and freezing.

recipes.name: Creamy Parmesan Farfalle with Peas
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the farfalle pasta and cook according to package directions until al dente.
Step 2: Add the frozen peas to the pasta pot 1 minute before the pasta is finished cooking.
Step 3: Drain the pasta and peas and return them to the pot.

Step 4: While the pasta is cooking, prepare the sauce. In a large skillet, combine the heavy cream and chicken broth. Bring to a simmer over medium heat and cook until slightly thickened, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 5: Stir in the Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth.
Step 6: Add the cream sauce to the drained pasta and peas. Toss gently to coat evenly.
Step 7: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately, garnished with extra Parmesan cheese, if desired.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture creamy Parmesan farfalle with peas in a rustic, inviting setting.  Use soft, diffused natural light from the side to highlight the creamy texture and vibrant green peas against the bow tie pasta.  Shallow depth of field focuses on a twirl of pasta lifted by a fork, with the remaining dish slightly blurred.  Incorporate a linen napkin and weathered wooden background. Garnish with a sprinkle of Parmesan and a sprig of fresh parsley.  Aim for a warm, comforting mood.

video_script.title: Creamy Parmesan Farfalle with Peas
video_script.description: A quick and easy pasta recipe featuring a creamy Parmesan sauce and sweet peas.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished plate of Creamy Parmesan Farfalle with Peas, garnished with extra Parmesan. Steam is gently rising. Focus on the creamy texture and vibrant green peas.
scenes.voice_over: Craving a comforting pasta dish that's ready in minutes? Look no further! Today, we're making Creamy Parmesan Farfalle with Peas – a simple yet flavorful recipe perfect for any weeknight.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table: farfalle pasta, frozen peas, heavy cream, chicken broth, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: farfalle pasta, frozen peas, heavy cream, chicken broth, grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.

scenes.image_prompt: A large pot of boiling salted water with farfalle pasta being added.
scenes.voice_over: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Add 12 ounces of farfalle pasta and cook according to the package directions until al dente. This usually takes about 8-10 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Frozen peas being added to the pot with the pasta one minute before it's finished cooking.
scenes.voice_over: One minute before the pasta is done, add 10 ounces of frozen peas to the pot.

scenes.image_prompt: Pasta and peas being drained in a colander.
scenes.voice_over: Once the pasta and peas are cooked, drain them well and set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Heavy cream and chicken broth simmering in a large skillet.
scenes.voice_over: While the pasta is cooking, prepare the sauce. In a large skillet, combine 3/4 cup of heavy cream and 1/3 cup of low sodium chicken broth. Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat and cook until slightly thickened, about 5-7 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Parmesan cheese being stirred into the simmering cream sauce until melted and smooth.
scenes.voice_over: Stir in 1/2 cup of grated Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth. The sauce should be rich and creamy.

scenes.image_prompt: Creamy Parmesan sauce being tossed with the drained pasta and peas.
scenes.voice_over: Add the drained pasta and peas to the skillet with the cream sauce. Toss gently until everything is evenly coated.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a serving of Creamy Parmesan Farfalle with Peas in a bowl, garnished with extra Parmesan and freshly ground black pepper.
scenes.voice_over: Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately, garnished with extra Parmesan cheese if desired. This dish is also delicious with a side of grilled chicken or crusty bread. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use freshly grated Parmesan cheese.
If you don't have chicken broth, you can substitute with vegetable broth or water.
To prevent the pasta from sticking, add a tablespoon of olive oil to the boiling water.

recipes.name: Classic American Kid-Friendly Casserole
ingredients: 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup
directions: Step 1: Cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside, reserving the bacon grease.
Step 2: Slice 3 of the hot dogs.
Step 3: In the same skillet, using some of the reserved bacon grease, sauté the sliced hot dogs, chopped celery, and chopped onion over medium heat until the onion is softened.
Step 4: Sprinkle the flour, salt, and pepper over the hot dog mixture and stir to combine.
Step 5: Gradually whisk in the evaporated milk and cream of celery soup. Bring the mixture to a simmer, reduce the heat to low, and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
Step 6: Crumble the cooked bacon and add it to the sauce.
Step 7: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 8: In a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish, layer half of the cooked macaroni noodles, then half of the cream sauce. Repeat the layers with the remaining noodles and sauce.
Step 9: Slice the remaining 2 hot dogs and arrange them over the top of the casserole. Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese evenly over the top.
Step 10: Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly and the casserole is heated through.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of a bubbly, golden-brown American kid-friendly casserole, fresh from the oven, in a vintage Pyrex dish.  Focus on the creamy texture and crispy bacon bits. Use soft, natural light from the side to highlight the steam and create depth.  Include a checkered napkin and a vintage fork as props on a rustic wooden table. Shallow depth of field with focus on the center of the casserole.  Warm, comforting, and nostalgic mood.

video_script.title: Classic American Kid-Friendly Casserole
video_script.description: A comforting and easy casserole recipe that's perfect for kids and adults alike!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a bubbly, golden-brown casserole with sliced hot dogs on top and melted cheddar cheese. Steam gently rises from the dish. Focus on the texture and delicious appearance.
scenes.voice_over: This classic American casserole is a guaranteed crowd-pleaser.  It's cheesy, comforting, and packed with flavor that kids and adults will love. Let's get started!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden table. Group related ingredients like the canned goods, the hot dogs and bacon, and the chopped vegetables.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: hot dogs, bacon, celery, onion, flour, salt, pepper, evaporated milk, cream of celery soup, cooked macaroni, and cheddar cheese.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of bacon sizzling in a skillet. Focus on the crispy texture and golden color.
scenes.voice_over: First, cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until it's nice and crispy.  Set aside and save that precious bacon grease!

scenes.image_prompt: The sliced hot dogs, celery, and onions are sauteed in the bacon grease. Show the mixture cooking, with some light browning on the edges.
scenes.voice_over: Next, slice 3 of the hot dogs.  Sauté the sliced hot dogs, chopped celery, and onion in the reserved bacon grease until the onion softens.

scenes.image_prompt: Flour, salt, and pepper being sprinkled over the hot dog mixture, followed by whisking in evaporated milk and cream of celery soup.
scenes.voice_over: Sprinkle in flour, salt, and pepper.  Then gradually whisk in the evaporated milk and cream of celery soup. Simmer for 10 minutes, or until thickened, stirring occasionally.

scenes.image_prompt: Crumbled bacon being added to the creamy sauce, which is now thickened and bubbly.
scenes.voice_over: Crumble the cooked bacon and stir it into the sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Layering macaroni and sauce in a casserole dish. Show the process of layering half of the macaroni, then sauce, and repeating the layers.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 350°F. In a casserole dish, layer half the macaroni, half the sauce, then repeat with the remaining macaroni and sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Sliced hot dogs arranged on top of the casserole, followed by a generous sprinkle of cheddar cheese.
scenes.voice_over: Slice the remaining hot dogs and arrange them over the top. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake for 20-25 minutes, until bubbly and golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished casserole, golden brown and bubbly, being served with a spatula. A side of steamed green beans or a fresh salad is also shown.
scenes.voice_over: Serve this delicious casserole hot.  It's great on its own, or with a side of steamed green beans or a fresh salad. Each serving has about 400 calories, 20 grams of protein, 40 grams of carbs, and 20 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: For a healthier version, use turkey bacon and low-fat hot dogs.
Substitute different cheeses, such as mozzarella or Monterey Jack, for the cheddar cheese.
Add a pinch of garlic powder or onion powder to the sauce for extra flavor.
If you don't have cream of celery soup, you can make a white sauce using butter, flour, and milk, and add chopped celery or celery salt.

recipes.name: Kid-Friendly Molasses "Coffee"
ingredients: ¼ cup milk, half-and-half, or soy milk
directions: Step 1: Boil the water and pour it into a mug.
Step 2: Add the molasses and stir until dissolved.
Step 3: Add milk, half-and-half, or soy milk. Adjust the amount of milk to your preference.

Include a small pitcher of milk and a plate of gingersnaps as props.  Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the warm, inviting steam and creating a cozy, comforting mood.  Garnish with a dusting of cinnamon.

recipes.name: Peachy Keen Kid's Salad
directions: Step 1: For each salad, place one drained peach half, cut-side down, on a lettuce leaf on a plate.
Step 2: Arrange celery sticks around the peach half to resemble arms and legs.
Step 3: Place a marshmallow on top of the peach half for the head.
Step 4: If desired, add raisins for eyes, nose, buttons, hands, and feet.
Step 5: If using, place a small piece of chopped maraschino cherry for the mouth.
Step 6: If desired, sprinkle shredded cheese on top of the marshmallow for hair.
Step 7: Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Scatter optional raisins and chopped cherries. recipes.name: Kids' Bathtub Paints
ingredients: 1/3 cup mild clear dish soap (such as Joy)
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, mix the cornstarch and dish soap until well combined.
Step 2: Pour the mixture into an ice cube tray, filling each section about halfway.
Step 3: Add 4-8 drops of different food coloring to each section of the ice cube tray.
Step 4: Using a toothpick (or similar tool), mix the food coloring into the soap mixture in each section until evenly blended.
Step 5: Let the kids use the colorful soap paints in the bathtub!
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant, overhead close-up shot of several small white bowls filled with colorful "bathtub paints" made of dish soap and cornstarch.  Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the smooth, glossy texture of the paint in the foreground bowl.  Bright, natural lighting should highlight the vivid food coloring swirls.  Include a few small paintbrushes dipped in the paint, resting on a clean, white textured background.  A playful, cheerful mood should permeate the image, suggesting a fun and creative activity.  The overall composition should be minimalist and aesthetically pleasing.

video_script.title: DIY Bathtub Paints for Kids!
video_script.description: Make bath time fun with these easy, colorful, and safe bathtub paints!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of colorful soap paints swirling in a bathtub with a happy child playing.
scenes.text: Bath time just got a whole lot more fun!
scenes.voice_over: Get ready for some colorful, creative fun with homemade bathtub paints that are safe, easy, and inexpensive to make. Let's dive in!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ingredients neatly arranged on a table: a bottle of clear dish soap, a small bowl of cornstarch, an ice cube tray, a box of food coloring, and a few toothpicks.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: one-third cup of mild clear dish soap, one tablespoon of cornstarch, an ice cube tray, various food colorings, and some toothpicks for mixing.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a bowl with cornstarch and dish soap being mixed together with a spoon.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, combine the cornstarch and dish soap. Mix thoroughly until there are no lumps and the mixture is smooth.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of pouring the dish soap and cornstarch mixture into an ice cube tray, filling each section halfway.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the soap mixture into your ice cube tray. Fill each section about halfway.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of adding drops of different food coloring to each section of the ice cube tray filled with the soap mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Now for the fun part! Add a few drops of food coloring to each section of the ice cube tray. Get creative with different colors and color combinations.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of using a toothpick to mix the food coloring into the soap mixture in each section of the ice cube tray.
scenes.voice_over: Use a toothpick to swirl the food coloring into the soap mixture. Make sure the color is evenly distributed in each section.

scenes.image_prompt: A child happily painting on the bathtub walls with the colorful soap paints, creating fun designs.
scenes.voice_over: And that's it! Your DIY bathtub paints are ready. Let your little ones unleash their inner artist and enjoy a colorful bath time masterpiece!

scenes.image_prompt: A clean bathtub with a few colorful soap paint smears, a rubber ducky, and a happy child wrapped in a towel.
scenes.voice_over: Cleanup is a breeze! Simply rinse the bathtub with water. These soap paints are easy to wash away, leaving no stains.

cooking_tips: For easier cleanup, use a drop cloth or old towel under the ice cube tray while mixing the paints.
If the paint mixture is too thick, add a few drops of water to thin it out.
Supervise young children while they are using the bathtub paints.

recipes.name: Kid-Friendly Teriyaki Salmon
directions: Step 1: Place the salmon fillets in a resealable zip-top bag. Pour the teriyaki sauce over the salmon, seal the bag, and marinate in the refrigerator for 1-2 hours.
Step 2: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray or oil.
Step 3: Arrange the marinated salmon fillets skin-side down in the prepared baking dish.
Step 4: Sprinkle brown sugar evenly over the top of the salmon fillets. Adjust the amount of brown sugar according to your desired sweetness.
Step 5: Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. Cooking time may vary depending on the thickness of the fillets.
Step 6: Optional: Spoon the pan juices over the salmon before serving.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant, close-up shot of kid-friendly teriyaki salmon fillets glistening with a rich glaze.  Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the flaky, caramelized texture of the salmon.  A rustic wooden background and simple white plates should provide contrast. Garnish with a sprinkle of sesame seeds and chopped green onions.  Soft, natural light from the side should highlight the warm, inviting tones of the dish, creating a wholesome and appealing mood.  A slightly overhead angle showcasing the glistening glaze and flaky texture is ideal.

video_script.title: Kid-Friendly Teriyaki Salmon
video_script.description: A delicious and easy teriyaki salmon recipe that's perfect for kids!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished teriyaki salmon dish, glistening with the glaze, garnished with sesame seeds and chopped green onions. Served with a side of steamed rice and broccoli.
scenes.voice_over: Hey everyone! Today we're making a super easy and delicious teriyaki salmon that your kids will love. It's sweet, savory, and packed with flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden cutting board: salmon fillets, teriyaki sauce, brown sugar.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: salmon fillets, teriyaki sauce, and brown sugar. That's it!

scenes.image_prompt: Salmon fillets being placed in a zip-top bag and teriyaki sauce being poured over them.
scenes.voice_over: Place your salmon fillets in a zip-top bag and pour in the teriyaki sauce. Make sure each fillet is coated. Seal the bag and let it marinate in the fridge for at least 1-2 hours. This helps the salmon absorb all those amazing flavors.

recipes.name: Cheesy Corn Casserole
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
1 (8 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack and cheddar cheese blend
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 2-quart baking dish.
Step 2: In a large bowl, combine the beaten eggs, sour cream, cornmeal, melted margarine, drained corn, shredded cheese, celery salt, seasoning salt, and white pepper. Mix well.
Step 3: Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish.
Step 4: Bake uncovered for 45 minutes, or until the center is set.
Step 5: Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a cheesy corn casserole, fresh from the oven, in a rustic cast iron skillet.  Use warm, natural light to highlight the golden crust and melted cheese.  A shallow depth of field should focus on a spoonful being lifted, showcasing the creamy texture.  Style with a linen napkin and scattered kernels of corn.  The backdrop should be a dark, textured wood surface.  The mood should be inviting and comforting, evoking a sense of home-style cooking.

video_script.title: Cheesy Corn Casserole: A Comfort Food Classic
video_script.description: Learn how to make this easy and delicious cheesy corn casserole recipe. Perfect for potlucks, holidays, or a weeknight side dish.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a golden brown, bubbly cheesy corn casserole in a baking dish, steam gently rising. A serving spoon dips into the casserole, revealing the creamy, cheesy interior.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a classic cheesy corn casserole that's creamy, cheesy, and unbelievably easy. Perfect for any occasion.

scenes.voice_over: Start by whisking three large eggs in a bowl. Then, add in an 8-ounce carton of sour cream and mix until well combined.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of dry ingredients being added to the wet ingredients: cornmeal, melted margarine, spices. Show the mixing process until just combined.
scenes.voice_over: Add in half a cup of cornmeal, half a cup of melted margarine, half a teaspoon of celery salt, a teaspoon of seasoning salt, and a quarter teaspoon of white pepper. Mix everything together.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of adding the drained corn and shredded cheese to the mixture. Gentle folding motion to combine without overmixing.
scenes.voice_over: Now, gently fold in an 8-ounce can of drained whole kernel corn and an 8-ounce package of shredded Monterey Jack and cheddar cheese blend. Make sure it's evenly distributed throughout the mixture.

scenes.image_prompt: The prepared mixture being poured into a greased 2-quart baking dish.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the mixture into a greased 2-quart baking dish.

scenes.image_prompt: The baking dish in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C).
scenes.voice_over: Bake uncovered in a preheated oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius) for 45 minutes, or until the center is set.

scenes.image_prompt: The baked casserole being removed from the oven, golden brown and bubbly. A timer next to the dish shows 45 minutes.
scenes.voice_over: After 45 minutes, the casserole should be beautifully golden brown and bubbly.

scenes.image_prompt: The casserole resting for 5 minutes before being served.
scenes.voice_over: Let it rest for 5 minutes before serving. This allows the casserole to set and makes it easier to serve.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a slice of cheesy corn casserole being served.  Show a serving spoon scooping a portion onto a plate.  Suggestions for serving alongside the dish, such as a simple green salad or grilled chicken, can be in the background.
scenes.voice_over: This cheesy corn casserole is delicious on its own or as a side dish with grilled meats or a fresh salad. Each serving has approximately 250 calories, 12 grams of protein, 25 grams of carbs, and 15 grams of fat. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use creamed corn instead of whole kernel corn.
Add a pinch of paprika or cayenne pepper for a touch of heat.
Top with crumbled bacon or chopped green onions before serving.

recipes.name: Parmesan Sesame Breadsticks
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 450°F (232°C).
2. Split the hot dog buns lengthwise.
3. Brush the cut side of each bun with melted butter.
4. Place the buns on an ungreased baking sheet.
5. In a small bowl, combine the parmesan cheese and sesame seeds.
6. Sprinkle the cheese and sesame seed mixture evenly over the buttered buns.
7. Bake for 7-9 minutes, or until golden brown.

recipes.name: Kid-Friendly Dirt Cups
ingredients: 1 package (3.4 oz) instant chocolate pudding mix
1 container (8 oz) Cool Whip whipped topping
directions: Step 1: In a large mixing bowl, pour the cold milk.
Step 2: Add the instant chocolate pudding mix to the milk.
Step 3: Whisk the milk and pudding mix together vigorously for 1-2 minutes, until well blended.
Step 4: Let the pudding mixture stand for 5 minutes to thicken.
Step 5: Gently fold in the Cool Whip whipped topping and half of the crushed Oreo cookies.
Step 6: Place 1 tablespoon of crushed Oreo cookies into the bottom of each plastic cup.
Step 7: Fill each cup about 3/4 full with the pudding mixture.
Step 8: Top each cup with the remaining crushed Oreo cookies, creating a "dirt" layer.
Step 9: Refrigerate the dirt cups for at least 1 hour to chill and set.
Step 10: Decorate the dirt cups with gummy worms, gummy frogs, candy flowers, and chopped peanuts before serving.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up, slightly overhead shot of several Dirt Cups in clear plastic cups against a rustic wooden background.  Focus sharply on the creamy pudding layer and crushed Oreo "dirt," letting the gummy worms, frogs, and candy flowers gently blur in the foreground. Use soft, natural light to highlight the textures and rich brown, white, and vibrant candy colors. Incorporate a small, vintage-style shovel as a prop. Aim for a shallow depth of field with a bright and cheerful mood, evoking a playful, childlike sense of wonder.

video_script.title: Kid-Friendly Dirt Cups
video_script.description: Learn how to make these easy and fun no-bake dessert cups!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished dirt cup, garnished with gummy worms, frogs, candy flowers, and chopped peanuts. Focus on the layers and textures, making it look appealing.
scenes.voice_over: Hey everyone, today we're making a fun and easy dessert that kids will love: Dirt Cups! These no-bake treats are perfect for parties, snacks, or any occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a table: milk, pudding mix, Cool Whip, Oreos, plastic cups, and garnishes.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: milk, instant chocolate pudding mix, Cool Whip, Oreo cookies, clear plastic cups, and some fun garnishes like gummy worms, frogs, candy flowers, and chopped peanuts.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of whisking milk and pudding mix in a bowl.
scenes.voice_over: In a large bowl, whisk together the cold milk and pudding mix for about 2 minutes until it's well combined.  Let it sit for 5 minutes to thicken up.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of folding Cool Whip and crushed Oreos into the pudding mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Now, gently fold in the Cool Whip and half of the crushed Oreo cookies. Make sure not to overmix, so the pudding stays light and airy.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of layering crushed Oreos and pudding mixture in a plastic cup.
scenes.voice_over: Start by placing a tablespoon of crushed Oreos at the bottom of each cup. This is our first "dirt" layer. Then, fill the cups about 3/4 full with the pudding mixture.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of topping the dirt cups with the remaining crushed Oreos.
scenes.voice_over: Top each cup with the remaining crushed Oreos, creating the final "dirt" layer. Gently press down to create an even surface.

scenes.image_prompt: Shot of the dirt cups arranged on a tray, being placed in the refrigerator.
scenes.voice_over: Refrigerate the dirt cups for at least an hour to let them chill and set. This will help the flavors meld together and the "dirt" to firm up.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of decorating dirt cups with gummy worms, frogs, candy flowers, and chopped peanuts.
scenes.voice_over: Now for the fun part! Decorate your dirt cups with gummy worms, gummy frogs, candy flowers, and chopped peanuts. Get creative and make them your own!

scenes.image_prompt: Final shot of the finished dirt cups, garnished and ready to serve.  A few spoons are placed next to the cups.
scenes.voice_over: Your delicious and fun Dirt Cups are ready! These are a guaranteed hit with kids and adults alike. Enjoy!  Each serving has approximately 250 calories, 3 grams of protein, 40 grams of carbs, and 12 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: For a finer "dirt" topping, pulse the Oreo cookies in a food processor instead of crushing them by hand.
If you don't have clear plastic cups, you can use small bowls or glasses.
Get creative with the decorations! Use other candies, sprinkles, or even small toy insects to personalize your dirt cups.

recipes.name: Crunchy Dorito Sandwich
directions: Step 1: Slice the hard roll in half horizontally.
Step 2: Spread the softened butter evenly on the inside of both halves of the roll.
Step 3: Open the bag of Doritos and carefully pour the chips onto the bottom half of the roll.
Step 4: Place the top half of the roll over the Doritos to complete the sandwich.

Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the crushed Doritos spilling from the buttery, toasted roll.  Employ warm, natural lighting to highlight the golden hues of the bread and chips.  Garnish with a few scattered Doritos and a small sprig of fresh parsley.  The background should be a subtly textured, dark gray surface to create contrast and a slightly moody atmosphere.  Aim for a close-up composition with a slightly overhead angle, emphasizing the texture and inviting nature of the sandwich.

video_script.title: Crunchy Dorito Sandwich
video_script.description: A quick and easy snack or light meal: the Crunchy Dorito Sandwich!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of the ingredients neatly arranged on a table: a hard roll, a stick of butter on a small plate, and a single-serving bag of plain Doritos.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: one hard roll, one tablespoon of softened butter, and a single-serving bag of plain Doritos. That's it!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a hand slicing a hard roll in half horizontally using a serrated knife.
scenes.voice_over: First, slice the hard roll in half horizontally.  Make sure you have a clean, even cut.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a knife spreading softened butter onto the inside of both halves of the hard roll.
scenes.voice_over: Next, spread the softened butter evenly onto the inside of both halves of the roll. This adds a touch of richness and helps keep the chips in place.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a hand carefully pouring Doritos from the bag onto the bottom half of the buttered roll.
scenes.voice_over: Now, carefully open the bag of Doritos and pour the chips onto the bottom half of the roll.  Don't overload it!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of two hands placing the top half of the roll onto the bottom half, completing the Dorito sandwich.
scenes.voice_over: Finally, place the top half of the roll over the Doritos to complete the sandwich.  Gently press down to secure.

scenes.voice_over: Your Crunchy Dorito Sandwich is ready!  It's perfect as a quick snack or a light meal.  Enjoy it on its own or serve it with your favorite dipping sauce. This simple sandwich packs about 200-250 calories, 5-7 grams of protein, 25-30 grams of carbs, and 8-12 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: Use flavored Doritos for a different taste experience.
Add a slice of cheese for extra flavor and protein.
Serve with a side of fruit or vegetables for a more balanced snack.

recipes.name: Sautéed Kale with Mirin
ingredients: 1 bunch kale, leaves removed from stems and roughly chopped
directions: Step 1: Wash the kale thoroughly. Remove the leaves from the tough center stems and roughly chop the leaves.
Step 2: Place the chopped kale in a large (12-inch) frying pan.
Step 3: Add the olive oil, mirin, and salt to the pan.  (The measurements are approximate; adjust to taste.)
Step 4: Turn the heat to medium-high.
Step 5: Cover the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, until the kale is tender. This usually takes about 10-12 minutes.
Step 6: Taste the cooked kale and add more salt if needed. If the kale is particularly bitter, consider adding a small amount of brown sugar to balance the flavor.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture sautéed kale glistening with mirin in a close-up, slightly overhead shot.  Emphasize the vibrant green hue and textured leaves against a dark, rustic wooden backdrop. Use soft, diffused natural light from the side to create depth and highlight the glossy finish. A shallow depth of field focuses on the center of the dish, blurring a simple linen napkin and a dark ceramic serving spoon in the foreground.  Garnish sparingly with a sprinkle of flaky sea salt for added visual texture. The mood should be inviting, natural, and appetizing.

video_script.title: Sautéed Kale with Mirin
video_script.description: Learn how to make delicious and healthy sautéed kale with a touch of sweet mirin.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of finished sautéed kale with mirin in a pan. The kale is vibrant green and slightly wilted, glistening with a light coating of oil and mirin. Steam rises gently from the pan.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a simple yet flavorful side dish: Sautéed Kale with Mirin. It's quick, healthy, and adds a touch of sweetness to your meal.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden cutting board: a bunch of fresh kale, a bottle of olive oil, a bottle of mirin, and a small bowl of kosher salt.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: a bunch of fresh kale, olive oil, mirin, a Japanese sweet cooking sherry, and some kosher salt.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of hands washing and then chopping kale. Show the removal of the leaves from the tough center stems.
scenes.voice_over: First, wash the kale thoroughly.  Remove the leaves from the tough center stems and roughly chop them.

scenes.image_prompt: Chopped kale placed in a large frying pan.
scenes.voice_over: Place the chopped kale in a large frying pan. A 12-inch pan works well.

scenes.image_prompt: Olive oil, mirin, and salt being added to the pan with the kale.
scenes.voice_over: Add two to three tablespoons of olive oil, one to two tablespoons of mirin, and a pinch of kosher salt. Feel free to adjust these measurements to your liking.

scenes.image_prompt: The frying pan on a stovetop with the burner lit at medium-high heat. The pan is covered with a lid.
scenes.voice_over: Turn the heat to medium-high, cover the pan, and let it cook for about 10 to 12 minutes, stirring occasionally.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of someone tasting the cooked kale and adding a pinch of brown sugar.
scenes.voice_over: After 10-12 minutes, taste the kale. Add more salt if needed. If it's too bitter, add a pinch of brown sugar.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished dish, sautéed kale with mirin, served alongside grilled chicken or fish.
scenes.voice_over: This sautéed kale is a perfect side dish with grilled chicken or fish.  Enjoy!

scenes.image_prompt: The finished sautéed kale plated and ready to serve. The kale is vibrant and glistening.
scenes.voice_over: This simple Sautéed Kale with Mirin is a healthy and flavorful addition to any meal.  Thanks for watching!

cooking_tips: If your kale is particularly tough, you can steam it for a few minutes before sautéing to help soften it.
Mirin adds a subtle sweetness that complements the slight bitterness of kale. If you don't have mirin, you can substitute with a dry sherry or a small amount of honey or maple syrup.

recipes.name: Kid-Friendly Beef and Potato Casserole
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 2: Brown the ground beef and onions in a large skillet over medium heat. Drain off any excess fat.
Step 3: Add the minced garlic, tomato soup, salt, chili sauce, drained green beans, and black pepper to the skillet. Mix thoroughly.
Step 4: Pour the beef mixture into a 1.5-quart casserole dish.
Step 5: Spread the mashed potatoes evenly over the top of the beef mixture.
Step 6: Bake for 15 minutes, then sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese over the potatoes.
Step 7: Continue baking for another 15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Step 8: Let cool slightly before serving.
Step 9: To make and freeze: Assemble the casserole as directed, but do not bake. Wrap tightly and freeze. When ready to bake, thaw completely and bake as directed above.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a kid-friendly beef and potato casserole, bubbling with melted cheddar, in a rustic oval baking dish.  Use a slightly overhead, angled shot to showcase both the cheesy topping and the savory beef and vegetable filling. Soft, natural light should highlight the textures and vibrant colors. A simple linen napkin and a vintage fork alongside the dish add a touch of hominess. Shallow depth of field focuses on the melted cheese and foreground, creating a warm, inviting mood. Garnish with a sprinkle of chopped fresh parsley for a pop of color.

recipes.name: Patriotic Layered Drink
directions: Step 1: Fill a tall 12-ounce clear glass with ice cubes to the one-third mark.
Step 2: Pour in the cranberry juice (or fruit punch) to the one-third mark. Add a few more ice cubes.
Step 3: Pour in the blue Gatorade to the two-thirds mark. Add more ice cubes.
Step 4: Pour in the sugar-free 7-Up (or Sprite) to fill the glass. Serve immediately.

The vibrant red, white, and blue layers should be distinct and captivating. Use natural, bright lighting to illuminate the icy texture and enhance the drink's colors.  Garnish with fresh berries and a small American flag.  A shallow depth of field, focusing on the middle layer, will create a dreamy backdrop.  Style with a rustic wooden background and patriotic-themed napkins for a festive, summery mood.

recipes.name: Classic Kid-Friendly Omelet
ingredients: Optional: 1/4 cup chopped cooked sausage, diced bell peppers, chopped onions, or spinach
directions: Step 1: Gather all ingredients.
Step 2: Lightly coat a 10- or 12-inch non-stick or cast iron skillet with cooking spray or butter. Heat over medium heat.
Step 3: In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, water, salt, and pepper until light and fluffy.
Step 4: Once the skillet is hot (but not smoking), pour in the egg mixture.
Step 5: As the omelet begins to set, gently lift the edges with a spatula and tilt the pan to allow the uncooked egg to flow underneath.
Step 6: Repeat on the opposite side.
Step 7: If using, add the desired vegetables or meat to one half of the omelet.
Step 8: When the omelet is almost set, sprinkle the shredded cheese over the half with or without the added ingredients.
Step 9: Fold the other half of the omelet over the cheese and filling.
Step 10: Cook for another minute or two, until the cheese is melted and the filling is heated through.
Step 11: Slide the omelet onto a plate and serve immediately.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a classic kid-friendly omelet, glistening with melted cheddar cheese, on a rustic wooden cutting board.  Use soft, diffused natural light from the side to highlight the fluffy texture and golden color.  Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh parsley and chopped chives.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the cheese pull, with a slightly overhead angle.  Background should be subtly textured and neutral, creating a warm and inviting mood. Include a small fork placed casually beside the omelet.

video_script.title: Classic Kid-Friendly Omelet
video_script.description: Learn how to make a quick, easy, and delicious omelet that's perfect for kids! This recipe is customizable with their favorite fillings.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished, golden-brown omelet on a plate, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh parsley. Steam gently rises from the cheese filling. The background is slightly blurred, focusing on the texture and color of the omelet.
scenes.voice_over: Hi everyone, and welcome! Today, we're making a classic, kid-friendly omelet that's perfect for breakfast, lunch, or even a quick dinner.

This includes eggs, shredded cheddar cheese, chopped sausage, diced bell peppers, a small bowl of chopped onions, and some fresh spinach.  A whisk, salt and pepper shakers, and a skillet are also visible.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: eggs, water, salt, pepper, shredded cheddar cheese, and your favorite fillings. Today I'm using sausage, bell peppers, onions, and spinach. You can customize this with whatever your kids love.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of whisking eggs, water, salt, and pepper in a glass bowl until light and fluffy. The whisk is moving in a circular motion, and the mixture is becoming frothy.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, water, salt, and pepper until light and fluffy. This will give you a nice, airy omelet.

scenes.image_prompt: A non-stick skillet is heating on a stovetop over medium heat. A hand is lightly coating the pan with cooking spray. The background should be a kitchen setting.
scenes.voice_over: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly coat it with cooking spray or butter.

scenes.image_prompt: The egg mixture is being poured into the hot skillet. The mixture is spreading evenly across the pan. The pan is on the stovetop over medium heat.
scenes.voice_over: Once the skillet is hot, pour in the egg mixture. Be careful not to overheat the pan, or the eggs will cook too quickly.

scenes.image_prompt: A spatula is gently lifting the edges of the setting omelet, allowing uncooked egg to flow underneath. Focus is on the spatula and the edge of the omelet.
scenes.voice_over: As the omelet begins to set, gently lift the edges and tilt the pan to allow the uncooked egg to flow underneath. Repeat on all sides.

scenes.image_prompt: Chopped sausage, diced bell peppers, chopped onions, and spinach are being added to one half of the omelet. The other half remains plain. The cheese is not yet added.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add your chosen fillings to one half of the omelet.  I’m going with sausage, bell peppers, onions, and spinach. Spread them out evenly.

scenes.image_prompt: Shredded cheddar cheese is being sprinkled over the fillings on the omelet. The cheese is evenly distributed.  The scene is well-lit to showcase the cheese and fillings.
scenes.voice_over: Sprinkle the shredded cheese over the fillings. Make sure to use plenty of cheese for that extra cheesy goodness!

scenes.image_prompt: The empty half of the omelet is being folded over the filled and cheesy half. A spatula is used to gently fold it over. Focus is on the folding action.
scenes.voice_over: Carefully fold the other half of the omelet over the cheese and fillings. Cook for another minute or two, or until the cheese is melted and the filling is heated through.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished omelet is being slid from the skillet onto a plate. The omelet is golden brown and the cheese is melted and gooey.  Garnish with a sprig of parsley.
scenes.voice_over: Slide the omelet onto a plate and serve immediately. This is a fantastic and versatile meal that kids will love. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a fluffier omelet, add a splash of milk or cream along with the water.
Don't overcook the omelet, or it will become dry and rubbery.
Get creative with the fillings! Try adding different cheeses, vegetables, or meats.

recipes.name: Kids' Scrambled Eggs on Wholegrain Toast
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon olive oil or cooking spray
Fresh Italian parsley or chives, chopped (optional)
directions: Step 1: In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk. Season with salt and pepper.
Step 2: Lightly coat a small frying pan with olive oil or cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat.
Step 3: Pour the egg mixture into the hot pan and let it sizzle undisturbed for about 10 seconds.

Step 4: Using a wooden spoon or spatula, gently push the cooked egg from the edges of the pan towards the center, allowing the uncooked egg to flow underneath. Repeat this process 2-3 times until the eggs are mostly set but still slightly moist. This should take approximately 1-2 minutes.
Step 5: While the eggs are cooking, toast the bread slices to your desired level of doneness.
Step 6: Place the scrambled eggs on the toasted bread. Garnish with fresh parsley or chives, if desired, and add an extra sprinkle of black pepper to taste.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture two slices of golden-brown wholegrain toast topped with fluffy, light yellow scrambled eggs seasoned with freshly cracked black pepper. Use soft, natural lighting from the side to highlight the texture of the eggs and toast. A shallow depth of field should focus on the foreground eggs, blurring the background.  Incorporate a rustic wooden board, a linen napkin, and a small sprinkle of chopped parsley for a touch of freshness. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the vibrant colors and creating a warm, inviting mood.

scenes.voice_over: In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.

scenes.image_prompt: A small frying pan is being lightly coated with olive oil. The pan is on a stovetop over medium-high heat.
scenes.voice_over: Lightly coat a small frying pan with olive oil or cooking spray. Heat over medium-high heat.

scenes.image_prompt: The egg mixture is being poured into the hot pan. The eggs are starting to sizzle around the edges.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the egg mixture into the hot pan. Let it sizzle undisturbed for about 10 seconds.

scenes.image_prompt: A wooden spoon is gently pushing the cooked egg from the edges of the pan towards the center. Uncooked egg is flowing underneath. The eggs are mostly set but still slightly moist.
scenes.voice_over: Using a wooden spoon, gently push the cooked egg from the edges towards the center, letting the uncooked egg flow underneath. Repeat this for 1-2 minutes until the eggs are mostly set but still slightly moist.

scenes.image_prompt: Two slices of wholegrain bread are in a toaster. The toaster lever is pushed down. The bread is golden brown.
scenes.voice_over: While the eggs are cooking, toast your wholegrain bread.

scenes.image_prompt: Scrambled eggs are being placed on top of two slices of toasted wholegrain bread. Fresh parsley is being sprinkled on top.
scenes.voice_over: Place the cooked scrambled eggs on the toast. Garnish with fresh parsley or chives and an extra sprinkle of black pepper, if desired.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished dish of scrambled eggs on wholegrain toast is presented on a plate with a glass of milk and a side of fresh fruit. A child's hand reaches for a slice of toast with a fork.
scenes.voice_over: Serve these delicious scrambled eggs on toast with a glass of milk and some fresh fruit for a complete and balanced meal.

cooking_tips: For creamier scrambled eggs, add a dollop of sour cream or crème fraîche at the end of cooking.
Don't overcook the eggs, as they will become dry and rubbery. Remove them from the heat while they are still slightly moist, as they will continue to cook from the residual heat.
If using chives or parsley, chop them finely just before serving to maximize their fresh flavor.

directions: Step 1: Arrange the berries, Bunny Grahams, and pretzels in separate small bowls on a serving tray.

recipes.name: Heredia Hash
directions: Step 1: In a small saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil over high heat. Add the rice and vegetable oil. Cover, return to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and fluff with a fork.
Step 2: While the rice is cooking, melt the butter in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add the sliced hot dogs and cook until they begin to brown.

Step 3: Push the hot dogs to one side of the pan. Crack the eggs into the empty space and cook for about 1 minute. Break the yolks and stir gently to scramble the eggs. Continue cooking and stirring until the eggs are set.
Step 4: Add the cooked rice to the pan with the hot dogs and eggs. Stir to combine.
Step 5: Portion the hash onto plates. Top each serving with a slice of cheese, if desired. The heat from the hash will melt the cheese.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a Heredia Hash, vibrant and inviting, in soft, directional light. Focus on the glistening fried egg yolks and textured rice, using a shallow depth of field.  Compose the shot from a slightly overhead angle, showcasing the hash's golden-brown crust and pops of red from the hot dog slices.  Use a rustic wooden board as the backdrop, accented with a simple linen napkin and perhaps a sprinkle of chopped fresh parsley for garnish.  Aim for a warm, comforting mood, highlighting the steam rising from the dish.

video_script.title: Heredia Hash: Quick & Easy Comfort Food
video_script.description: Learn how to make Heredia Hash, a simple yet satisfying dish perfect for any meal. This recipe combines fluffy rice, savory hot dogs, and scrambled eggs for a protein-packed breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

scenes.voice_over: While the rice is cooking, melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a pan over medium heat. Add your sliced hot dogs and cook until they start to brown.

scenes.voice_over: Push the hot dogs to the side and crack 3 eggs into the pan. Cook for about a minute, then break the yolks and scramble until they are set.

scenes.image_prompt: Cooked rice being added to the pan with the eggs and hot dogs.
scenes.voice_over: Once the rice is cooked, add it to the pan with the hot dogs and eggs.

scenes.image_prompt: A spatula stirring the rice, eggs, and hot dogs together in the pan.
scenes.voice_over: Stir everything together until well combined.

scenes.voice_over: Serve the hash immediately. Top with a slice of cheese, if you like. The heat from the hash will melt the cheese perfectly.  Each serving has roughly 350 calories, 15 grams of protein, 40 grams of carbs, and 15 grams of fat.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a fork taking a bite of the Heredia Hash with melted cheese. Steam is still visible.
scenes.voice_over: Enjoy your delicious and easy Heredia Hash!

cooking_tips: Substitute leftover cooked meats like roast beef, pork, chicken, or meatloaf for the hot dogs.

recipes.name: Simple Creamy Pasta
directions: Step 1: Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Step 2: In a saucepan, heat the condensed soup over medium heat until warmed through. Do not boil.
Step 3: Add the drained pasta to the saucepan with the heated soup. Toss gently to coat the pasta evenly.
Step 4: Serve immediately.

video_script.title: Adult Bailey's Milkshake
video_script.description: Indulge in this creamy, boozy treat - a perfect dessert cocktail!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a tall glass filled with a creamy, tan-colored milkshake. It's topped with whipped cream, a chocolate swirl, a pirouline cookie, vanilla wafers, and a fresh mint sprig. The background is slightly blurred, showcasing a dimly lit bar setting.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today we're making a decadent Adult Bailey's Milkshake, perfect for a sweet treat any time of day.

scenes.image_prompt: French vanilla ice cream, Hershey's chocolate syrup, and a bottle of Bailey's Irish Cream arranged on a dark countertop. Focus on the creamy textures.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: French vanilla ice cream, Hershey's chocolate syrup, and the star of the show - Bailey's Irish Cream.

scenes.image_prompt: Milk or eggnog next to a banana on the same dark counter as scene 2. Optionally, the banana can be in a small bowl to represent combining it with the milk.
scenes.voice_over: You'll also need milk, or if you're feeling extra festive, eggnog.  A banana is optional but recommended if using milk, for extra creaminess and flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: A blender with the ice cream, chocolate syrup, Bailey's, and milk/eggnog (and banana if using) inside.  The ingredients are not yet blended. The background is still the same dark counter.
scenes.voice_over: Add the ice cream, chocolate syrup, Bailey's, and your choice of milk/banana or eggnog to a blender.

scenes.image_prompt: The blender blending the ingredients on a low speed.  The contents should be swirling smoothly.
scenes.voice_over: Blend on a low setting until everything is just combined. Don't over-blend!

scenes.image_prompt: The blended milkshake being poured into two tall glasses. The glasses should be similar to the one shown in the first scene.
scenes.voice_over: Pour or spoon your milkshake into tall glasses.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of hands garnishing the milkshakes with whipped cream, a chocolate swirl, pirouline cookies, vanilla wafers, and a mint sprig. The process of adding each garnish should be highlighted individually.
scenes.voice_over: Now for the fun part: garnish with whipped cream, a chocolate swirl, pirouline cookies, vanilla wafers, and a fresh mint sprig.

scenes.image_prompt: Two finished Adult Bailey's Milkshakes, garnished as in the previous scenes. The background can be a slightly out-of-focus festive setting.  A small spoon or straw can be in the glass
scenes.voice_over: There you have it!  Your Adult Bailey's Milkshake is ready to enjoy.  This recipe makes about two servings, with each serving being around 400 to 500 calories. Cheers!

cooking_tips: For a thicker milkshake, use less milk or eggnog. For a thinner milkshake, use more.
If using a frozen banana, you may need to add a little more liquid.
Adjust the amount of Bailey's to your liking. Start with less and add more until you reach your preferred flavor.

recipes.name: Cheesy Brussels Sprouts for Kids
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Place the frozen Brussels sprouts in a medium microwave-safe dish.
Step 2: Add 2-3 tablespoons of water to the dish, just enough to barely cover the bottom.
Step 3: Cover the dish with plastic wrap and microwave on high for 4 minutes. Cooking time may vary depending on your microwave.
Step 4: Carefully vent the plastic wrap to avoid steam burns.
Step 5: Season with freshly ground black pepper, if desired.
Step 6: Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese over the Brussels sprouts.
Step 7: Replace the plastic wrap and microwave on high for another 3 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Step 8: Serve immediately and enjoy!
recipes.image_prompt: Photograph cheesy Brussels sprouts for kids, styled in a rustic white bowl on a light wood surface. Capture a slightly overhead, three-quarters angle, showcasing the melted cheese and texture of the sprouts. Use soft, natural lighting to highlight the vibrant green and golden cheese. A shallow depth of field emphasizes the cheesy pull, with the foreground sprouts in sharp focus. Include a small wooden fork as a prop, and garnish with a sprinkle of freshly cracked black pepper. Aim for a bright, playful, and inviting mood.

video_script.title: Cheesy Brussels Sprouts for Kids
video_script.description: A quick and easy recipe for cheesy Brussels sprouts that even picky eaters will love!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a plate of vibrant green cheesy Brussels sprouts, glistening with melted cheddar, steam gently rising. Some sprouts are cut open, showing the cheesy interior. A child's fork is reaching for a sprout.
scenes.voice_over: Introducing cheesy Brussels sprouts – a healthy and delicious side dish the whole family will enjoy, especially the kids!  This recipe takes just minutes to make in the microwave.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a kitchen counter: a bag of frozen Brussels sprouts, a block of cheddar cheese being shredded, and a pepper grinder.
scenes.voice_over: Here’s what you’ll need: frozen Brussels sprouts, sharp cheddar cheese, some water, and freshly ground black pepper (optional).

scenes.image_prompt: Frozen Brussels sprouts being placed into a microwave-safe dish.
scenes.voice_over: Place the frozen Brussels sprouts in a microwave-safe dish.

scenes.image_prompt: Water being added to the dish with Brussels sprouts. Highlight the small amount of water needed.
scenes.voice_over: Add just a couple of tablespoons of water, enough to create a little steam and help them cook evenly.

scenes.image_prompt: The dish, covered with plastic wrap, being placed in the microwave. Microwave timer showing 4:00.
scenes.voice_over: Cover the dish with plastic wrap and microwave on high for 4 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: The dish being removed from the microwave with oven mitts. Steam escaping from the vent in plastic wrap.
scenes.voice_over: Carefully vent the plastic wrap and season with freshly ground black pepper, if desired.

scenes.image_prompt: Shredded cheddar cheese being sprinkled over the steamed Brussels sprouts.
scenes.voice_over: Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese generously over the Brussels sprouts.

scenes.image_prompt: Dish with cheese covered in plastic wrap being microwaved. Microwave timer showing 3:00.
scenes.voice_over: Cover and microwave for another 3 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the finished cheesy Brussels sprouts being served with a spatula. The dish is on a table, alongside other kid-friendly foods like chicken nuggets and mashed potatoes.
scenes.voice_over: Serve immediately as a delicious and healthy side dish. These cheesy Brussels sprouts pair well with chicken nuggets, mashed potatoes, or your child’s favorite protein.

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use freshly grated cheddar cheese.
If you prefer, you can steam the Brussels sprouts on the stovetop instead of microwaving them.
Add a pinch of garlic powder or onion powder for extra flavor.
